label: Joint bank account statements
description: Statements from a bank account held jointly by both partners showing regular shared transactions.
what_it_proves: Demonstrates the financial pillar of relationship evidence — shared finances and financial interdependence.
common_gaps: Account opened recently — only a few months of statements
Both names on account but transactions show only one person using it
No regularity of shared expenses (rent, bills, groceries)
format_notes: 3–12 months of statements. Highlight shared recurring expenses. Include joint loans, joint insurance, or co-signed leases as supplementary evidence.

label: Shared lease or property documents
description: Rental agreement, mortgage documents, or property ownership records listing both partners as co-tenants or co-owners at shared address(es).
what_it_proves: Demonstrates the household pillar — cohabitation and shared domestic arrangements.
common_gaps: Only one partner's name on the lease
Multiple addresses during relationship with unexplained gaps in cohabitation
Lease for a property where both partners are not listed as tenants
format_notes: Include any lease renewals to show continuity. If only one partner is on the lease, supplement with utility bills at the same address for both partners.

label: Photographs together across multiple events and dates
description: Collection of dated photographs showing the couple together across different events, locations, and time periods during their relationship.
what_it_proves: Contributes to the social pillar — demonstrates a genuine shared life and ongoing relationship.
common_gaps: All photos from a single event or period — lacks temporal spread
Photos are screenshots without metadata or dates
No photos with friends or family who can corroborate the relationship
format_notes: Select a curated, chronological set rather than hundreds of undifferentiated images. Include captions with date and location. Print or digital both accepted.

label: Statutory declarations from third parties
description: Statutory declarations from people who know both partners well (friends, family, colleagues) confirming knowledge of the relationship, its duration, and its genuine nature.
what_it_proves: Contributes to both social and commitment pillars — third-party corroboration is a strong indicator of genuine relationship.
common_gaps: Statutory declarations are identical in wording — suggests template was used by multiple declarants
Declarants have only met one partner — must know both
Declaration not properly witnessed or signed
format_notes: Each declarant must be a separate person and must have witnessed the relationship. Include declarant's contact details, relationship to the couple, and how long they have known both partners.

label: Sponsor's citizenship or residency evidence
description: Australian passport, citizenship certificate, ImmiCard, or permanent visa grant letter confirming the sponsor's eligible status.
what_it_proves: Confirms the sponsoring partner is an eligible Australian citizen, permanent resident, or eligible NZ citizen.
common_gaps: Sponsor's permanent visa has expired or been cancelled
NZ citizen sponsor may need to check specific eligibility — not all NZ citizens qualify
format_notes: Certified copy or original. For permanent visa holders, include the visa grant notice or VEVO confirmation.
